predmark 1.0.0

  • Changelog

Daily forecast probabilities of all 2018 Midterm races

Source: R/data.R
model18.Rd

The election forecast probabilities from the 2018 FiveThirtyEight "classic" midterm model. Probabilities are taken by estimating vote share and a probability distribution from historical data.

model18

Format

A data frame with 1,049 rows and 11 variables:

date

Prediction date

race

Unique race code

name

Candidate name

party

Candidate party

chamber

Chamber of Congress: House or Senate

special

Is this election a special election?

incumbent

Is the candidate the incumbent?

prob

Probability candidate wins

voteshare

Median estimated share of vote

min_share

10th percentile vote share

max_share

90th percentile vote share

...

Source

https://fivethirtyeight.com/

Details

As Nate Silver explains, most forecasting models (1) “take lots of polls, perform various types of adjustments to them, and then blend them with other kinds of empirically useful indicators to forecast each race”. Importantly, they (2) “account for the uncertainty in the forecast and simulate the election thousands of times” to generate a probabilistic forecast.

The classic model incorporates three types of inputs, primarily direct and imputed polling as well as fundamentals factors like incumbency and the generic ballot.
